text.text: Highlights of Russian Military Operation in Ukraine on April 15-16

text: ‚ñ™Ô∏èUkrainian units again shelled the border areas of Kursk region.

were hit. There were no casualties as a result of the fire raid. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èShelling of Shebekinsky city district in Belgorod region continues. 
 
In

, residential buildings were damaged by artillery shells, an elderly woman was wounded. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn Lyman sector, Russian troops continue their offensive against AFU positions in

area. 
 
As a result of the fighting, several enemy strongholds were taken under control, which made possible to align the front line. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èAfter the transfer of the flanks to the responsibility of the airborne units, the Wagner PMC's assault groups increased pressure on the AFU positions in Bakhmut suburbs.   
  
Fierce battles are taking place in

outskirts.  

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn the north-west of the besieged

, Wagner PMC's units proceed to actively advance in urban blocks. 
 
AFU units retreat to the railway station area, which is currently one of the central defence hubs. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn the southern districts, savage street fighting continues in the 9 Travnya St area. 
 
Despite the desperate resistance, the Russian forces are methodically pushing the enemy, freeing house after house. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èDuring the All-night Easter service, the Kiev regime deliberately attacked the Svyato-Preobrazhens πkyy Kafedral πnyy Sobor of
As a result of the uncivilized missile strike, a woman was killed and seven other people were wounded.

text:
–¢–∞–∫, –ü–Ω–í—à–Ω–∏–∫–∏.

–í–æ—Ç –Ω–∞–±—Ä–æ—Å–æ–∫ —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–∞ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–º –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –±—ã –∑–∞–∫–∏–¥–∞—Ç—å –û–û–ù–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏—Ö —á–∏–Ω—É—à –≤ –°–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–º –∫–æ–æ—Ä–¥–∏–Ω–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–µ –≤ –°—Ç–∞–º–±—É–ª–µ.

Good afternoon. 
 
The latest statement from UN Secretary General Spokesman S. Dujarric states that "On April 11, 2023, the Joint Coordination Centre (JCC) has not been able to conduct inspections today as the parties needed more time to reach an agreement on operational priorities."  It is also noted that "the UN team is working closely with all sides, taking into consideration all parties‚Äô concerns." On April 12, 2023, the UN representative to the JCC, Ismini Palla, stated that "normal inspection patterns resumed on Wednesday after the parties agreed on a list of ships." On April 13, 2023, the Russian Foreign Ministry in its press release drew attention of all participants of the Black Sea Grain Initiative to the lack of real progress on the normalization of Russian agricultural exports,  with which the Russian Federation links further extension of its participation in the "grain deal.  In this connection, taking into account the importance and significance of the Initiative in the issue of global food security, the our team would like the following comments from the JCC: 

1. what "normal inspection patterns" is I.Palla's statement referring to?

2. How does Mr. A.Dashti, UN Coordinator for the BSGI, assess the further prospects for extending the Initiative after May 18 in the absence of progress on ammonia exports, which is one of Russia's five known conditions?

3 As far as we know, the text of the initiative clearly stipulates a provision on the export of fertilizers, including ammonia. Many speak of the supposedly successful functioning of the Istanbul mechanism. However, in practice, the shipment of fertilizers has not yet started. What are the main obstacles in this area, is it being discussed at the JCC? What work do the UN representatives at the JCC with authorized representatives of the Ukrainian side to ensure the transportation of fertilizers, including ammonia, from Ukraine? 
 
We would be glad to receive your comments

–ü–æ–≥–Ω–∞–ª–∏

text_entities.text:
–¢–∞–∫, –ü–Ω–í—à–Ω–∏–∫–∏.

–í–æ—Ç –Ω–∞–±—Ä–æ—Å–æ–∫ —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–∞ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–º –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –±—ã –∑–∞–∫–∏–¥–∞—Ç—å –û–û–ù–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏—Ö —á–∏–Ω—É—à –≤ –°–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–º –∫–æ–æ—Ä–¥–∏–Ω–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–µ –≤ –°—Ç–∞–º–±—É–ª–µ.

Good afternoon. 
 
The latest statement from UN Secretary General Spokesman S. Dujarric states that "On April 11, 2023, the Joint Coordination Centre (JCC) has not been able to conduct inspections today as the parties needed more time to reach an agreement on operational priorities."  It is also noted that "the UN team is working closely with all sides, taking into consideration all parties‚Äô concerns." On April 12, 2023, the UN representative to the JCC, Ismini Palla, stated that "normal inspection patterns resumed on Wednesday after the parties agreed on a list of ships." On April 13, 2023, the Russian Foreign Ministry in its press release drew attention of all participants of the Black Sea Grain Initiative to the lack of real progress on the normalization of Russian agricultural exports,  with which the Russian Federation links further extension of its participation in the "grain deal.  In this connection, taking into account the importance and significance of the Initiative in the issue of global food security, the our team would like the following comments from the JCC: 

1. what "normal inspection patterns" is I.Palla's statement referring to?

2. How does Mr. A.Dashti, UN Coordinator for the BSGI, assess the further prospects for extending the Initiative after May 18 in the absence of progress on ammonia exports, which is one of Russia's five known conditions?

3 As far as we know, the text of the initiative clearly stipulates a provision on the export of fertilizers, including ammonia. Many speak of the supposedly successful functioning of the Istanbul mechanism. However, in practice, the shipment of fertilizers has not yet started. What are the main obstacles in this area, is it being discussed at the JCC? What work do the UN representatives at the JCC with authorized representatives of the Ukrainian side to ensure the transportation of fertilizers, including ammonia, from Ukraine? 
 
We would be glad to receive your comments

–ü–æ–≥–Ω–∞–ª–∏

text.text: Highlights of Russian Military Operation in Ukraine on April 17

text:
‚ñ™Ô∏èUkrainian drones struck the energy infrastructure of Belgorod region. 

Explosion caused a fire at substations in

‚ñ™Ô∏èAt the same time throughout the day the enemy shelled the border population centres of the region.

Houses and infrastructure were hit in

, Russian troops continue their offensive on  AFU positions.

Intense fighting is recorded to the southeast of the settlement, where advanced units managed to break into the enemy's defences. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èStorming of

continues, with Russian forces currently controlling more than 80 per cent of the city.  

Despite the dire situation, the Ukrainian command continues its pointless resistance, sending more and more units to their deaths. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn the northern part of the city, Wagner PMC fighters continue to press the enemy along the entire front line. 

Ukrainian formations have withdrawn from Artemivsk elevator area, losing another important point of defence. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn the centre and south of the city there is intense street fighting for the railway station and multi-storey buildings. 

Despite some successes of the Russian forces, AFU continues to hold a steady line of defence in this part of the city.

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn

, heavy fighting continues in the central quarters west of Druzhba Avenue. 

Russian artillery strikes on AFU supply routes, hampering attempts to move fresh units into the city.

text.text: Highlights of Russian Military Operation in Ukraine on April 18

text:
‚ñ™Ô∏èRussian President Vladimir Putin personally visited the headquarters of the Dnepr and Vostok groupings in the area of the special military operation. 

The visit of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief is intended to inspire the personnel before the start of full-scale combat operations. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn Kup'yans'k sector, Russian Aerospace Forces carried out airstrikes on Ukrainian positions near

High-precision munitions based on FAB-500 aerial bombs were again used to hit enemy positions.

‚ñ™Ô∏èRussian Geran-2 drones attacked AFU military facilities in

Ukrainian units' deployment point, located at Power Engineering College, was hit. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èNear

artillery units of Airborne Troops established tight fire control over AFU supply routes. 

Having strengthened their flanks, Russian paratroopers cut the threat of counterattacks by Ukrainian formations.

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn the north of

, Russian units advanced along Tolbuhina Street, capturing a hospital and a garage areas. 

In addition, intense fighting is going on in the area of the railway elevator and Kraynyaya Street.

‚ñ™Ô∏èTo the south, the battle for the road to

continues. 

The Ukrainian command is constantly sending fresh reserves into the battle, trying to hold on to the strategically important route.

‚ñ™Ô∏èNear

Ukrainian formations made unsuccessful attempt to storm Russian positions.

Caught by concentrated attack by infantry units and army aviation, AFU units were pushed back to their initial positions.

text.text: *If you want to support our project, you could use

text.text: Highlights of Russian Military Operation in Ukraine on April 19

text: ‚ñ™Ô∏èUkrainian drones attacked a sugar factory in the border village of

Kursk Region. 

At least ten grenade launchers were fired at factory. The nearby school and kindergarten were not damaged.

‚ñ™Ô∏èAnother UAV attempted an attack on infrastructure near
Ukrainian UAV with an improvised explosive device was detected and shot down near the village of
‚ñ™Ô∏èIn Starobil's'k direction, intense fighting continues in the area of

The AFU made an unsuccessful attempt at an offensive in the wooded area, but were pushed back to their initial positions. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èWagner PMC together with airborne troops units continue to storm the AFU positions on the outskirts of
The city is virtually blocked from the north and south, and the road to

is under constant Russian artillery fire control.

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn the center of

the AFU suffer heavy losses and lose positions under the onslaught of Russian assault groups.  

Over the past 24 hours, the Wagner PMC assault groups managed to take control over a former garment factory building.

‚ñ™Ô∏èTo the south, near the road to

the AFU managed to concentrate enough forces and launched a counterattack.
 
Despite high losses from Russian artillery fire, the AFU gained a foothold in

which had previously been in the gray zone.

‚ñ™Ô∏èRussian troops launched kamikaze drone strikes on AFU facilities in

and its suburbs.

Children's camp Victoria, used by AFU for personnel deployment, was one of the targets of the attack.

text.text: Highlights of Russian Military Operation in Ukraine on April 20

text:
, there occurred an off-nominal drop of aviation munition from Su-34 bomber of Russian Aerospace Forces.

As a result of the subsequent explosion, residential buildings were damaged, with at least two civilians injured.

‚ñ™Ô∏èUkrainian forces again launched a mortar attack on the village of

in the Bryansk region. 

Shell fragments damaged residential houses and an electrical substation. There are casualties among civilians. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èArtillery duels and positional battles continue along the entire front line in the Kupyansk area.

An enemy sabotage and reconnaissance group was identified and destroyed near
‚ñ™Ô∏èWagner PMC groups continue their operation to encircle

from the flanks. 

On the northwestern outskirts, the advance units pushed through the enemy's defenses and came close to the road to

‚ñ™Ô∏èA large area of the city east of the railroad has been liberated in the central quarters. 

Russian forces have taken control of a complex of warehouses. The front line has shifted to the high-rise buildings. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èRussian motorized rifle units continue to storm enemy positions in

In the southern part of the city, the fighting has shifted to the western side of Druzhba Avenue, creating preconditions for a further offensive.

‚ñ™Ô∏èThe storming of

fortification continues: the enemy went into a blind defense, slowing the pace of Russian advance. 

The Ukrainian positions are under intensive fire from artillery and Solntsepyok heavy flamethrower systems.

text.text: *If you want to support our project, you could use

The Ukrainian positions are under intensive fire from artillery and Solntsepyok heavy flamethrower systems.

text.text: Highlights of Russian Military Operation in Ukraine on April 21

text:
in the Bryansk region.

Residential house was damaged as a result of munition detonation. No casualties. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èRussian Geran-2 kamikaze UAVs continue to hit infrastructure facilities in Ukraine. 

AFU fuel storage facilities were allegedly targeted in the
‚ñ™Ô∏èWagner PMC assault groups are conducting an offensive near
in order to cut off one of the two remaining roads to

The enemy understands the importance of the road and is trying to counterattack to push Russian units back.

‚ñ™Ô∏èIn the northern districts of

Wagner PMC assault groups continue to push the enemy.  

Russian fighters have occupied several blocks in the area of Cherniakhivskoho and Tolbuhina Streets, coming up close to the Olympic Reserve School.

‚ñ™Ô∏èTo the south, the front line is gradually shifting to the west: fighting for Hryhoriya Skovorody Street is taking place.  

Despite losing positions along the railway line, the AFU continues to desperately fight back. 

‚ñ™Ô∏èThe Kyiv regime continues massive shelling of residential areas of

Another attack killed a woman and damaged civilian infrastructure and high-rise buildings.

‚ñ™Ô∏èRussian units are storming AFU positions near the fire station in
Motorized rifle units try to outflank enemy positions and block their defensive units.
